result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Craig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.
.

Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Pay any unpaid financial obligations from probation.
.

From: DOC Re: Credit should be 332 days
EML: amend JOC indicating 332 days of sentence credit
Sentencing After Revocation held 6-25-15 w/ EML - filed by Teresa Carnal-Kolkind

PROBATION REVOCATION
Def in custody w/Atty O'Neil
CRT: sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence 3 1/2 years concurrent with 13CM1438
INITIAL CONFINEMENT: 18 MONTHS w/credit for 327 days
Def is eligible for CIP & ERP
EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 2 YEARS w/cond: no alcohol or CS w/random testing, no contact w/any known drug users/dealers, any other assess deemed approp by PO, pay DOC supervision fees, pay any unpaid financial obligations
assigned PO Emma Peterson
Revocation Summary

Def in custody w/atty O'Neil
O'Neil: get new date

App:  Team Anne P, Emma P, Casey, Officer / Def in custody w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
DRG COURT - EXPULSION HEARING
CRT:  recommendation frm team was for expulsion - letter dated 3-20-15 was issued by Anne P. - Atty O'Neil has reviewed that letter w/ def
O'Neil makes comments - team wants to know what will be different this time if def allowed to stay - there is no answer to that other than for def to be given another chance to prove himself.  Def's demeanor at times looks like he doesn't care but that is not true.  Def is no longer denying fact that he used in jail - he is willing to go to whatever lengths it takes to remain in the program.  Def has even req inpatient trmt, but knows that is unlikely but will go to institutional ATR if that is recommended.  Def had a sober lifestyle in the past...has not been up for expulsion before.  Req for another chance
Def comments - knows he hasn't shown dedication...bad choices, knowing all along this would help him....wants to be positive role model - req to remain in program
CRT:  comments...if not using tools provided, absconding, does not show commitment to program.  CRT also has to take into consideration other participants - those that are working hard & being committed.  CRT encourages def to become clean & sober - sees def as someone w/ potential but appears this was not right time for DRG CRT
CRT GRANTS MOTION TO EXPEL
DRG CRT HOLD ORDER - Def shall remain detained in LCJ until further order of CRT - signed by SlH  [filed in 14CF642]
